description: To the Editor:

title: Golden Globes 2018 Red Carpet Pictures
description: See all the looks.

title: Punk Music, Bronx Style
description: Roy Baizan has been chronicling the rock, punk, rap, trap and hip-hop scene in the Bronx, including shows produced by a new collective, Hydro Punk.

title: Punk Music, Bronx Style
description: Who knew the Bronx had punks? This shouldnt come as a surprise, since several musical genres were born in the borough, starting with doo-wop in the 1950s, salsa in the 60s and hip-hop in the 70s. Now Roy Baizan has discovered another scene.

title: Prediction: Change Coming for ESPNs FiveThirtyEight
description: Odds are a transition is underway at FiveThirtyEight, the data journalism website best known for its presidential election forecasts. ESPN, the websites parent company, may be planning to sell it outright or spin it off to a corporate sibling, according to a report published on Thursday.

title: Our Favorite Images from the Couture Shows
description: The spring/summer 2018 collections, held in Paris this week, were a feast for the eyes.

title: The Best Images from the Haute Couture Shows
description: Paris couture week remained its usual feast for the eyes, from Giambattista Vallis cinched mounds of tulle to fluttery Philip Treacy headpieces atop Valentino models, not to mention Iris van Herpens otherworldly 3-D printed dresses. There were, however, some very 2018 updates, like temporary neck tattoos courtesy of Christian Dior, an array of gowns with pockets at Chanel and Proenza Schoulers latest ready-to-wear collection off-schedule (as is the mode). See all of this and more, as captured by T photographers, in our slide show.

title: Warren Miller, Ski Bum Turned Filmmaker, Is Dead at 93
description: Warren Miller, a passionate skier and filmmaker whose movies introduced skiing and snowboarding to a wide audience, died on Wednesday at his home on Orcas Island in Puget Sound, near Seattle. He was 93.

title: The Hitchhiker
description: Dear Diary:

title: How Much Watching Time Do You Have This Weekend?
description: No matter how much free time you have this weekend, we have TV recommendations for you. Come back every Friday for new suggestions from our TV critic on what to watch.

title: Davos, Dreamers, Doomsday: Your Thursday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Goodspeed Cancels Woody Allen Musical
description: A Connecticut theater well known for presenting musicals has canceled a planned production of Bullets Over Broadway, following a sexual abuse allegation against Woody Allen.

title: The Case for Fancier Subways: We Deserve Them
description: One glance at the 205th Street station on the D line Thursday morning and you might think, case closed, the mayor has it right. The governor is too much in love with frills, not the unsexy nuts and bolts of keeping up the subway system.

title: Trump and Davos: Not Exactly Best Friends, but Not Enemies Either
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  When President Trump arrived on Thursday at the conference center where the worlds financial and political elite have been meeting, onlookers crowded a balcony and craned their heads to see the leader who has challenged the very international order that Davos represents. At first, it was quiet. Then someone called out a question.

title: A Museums Fresh Take on the Whole Megillah
description: The Jewish Museum is housed in one of New Yorks most ornate mansions: a French chateau sitting right on Fifth Avenue. Yet if you walk into its new permanent collection displays  airy, spotless, with light gray walls and freshly poured concrete floors  you may find yourself wondering if youve been teleported to Chelsea.

title: Why Is Pay Lagging? Maybe Too Many Mergers in the Heartland
description: BERLIN, Wis.  For as long as he can remember, the only thing Matt Gies really wanted to do for a living was repair farm equipment.

title: How Did Larry Nassar Get Away With It?
description: Lawrence G. Nassar, the sports doctor accused of sexually abusing hundreds of young women, committed his crimes with impunity for decades. Heres how.

title: Education Secretary Betsy DeVos Is Sued Over Sexual Assault Guidance
description: WASHINGTON  Victims rights and womens rights groups sued Education Secretary Betsy DeVos on Thursday, saying that rules that she issued last year to guide campuses on how to manage sexual assault complaints violated federal law and discriminated against accusers.

title: Trump and the Holocaust Remembrance: A Second Chance
description: Saturday is International Holocaust Remembrance Day. For President Trump, it is a shot at redemption.

title: The Quiet Radicalism of Melania Trump
description: On the first anniversary of his inauguration, President Trump spent the day blasting Democrats for the government shutdown, suggesting that women marching in protest of his presidency were somehow celebrating it, and embroiled in allegations that he paid off a porn star to keep her quiet about their relationship. Melania Trump, meanwhile, commemorated the anniversary by tweeting a single photo of herself on Inauguration Day on the arm of a Marine. Her husband was nowhere in sight, and she did not mention his name. A few days later  on what happened to be the Trumps 13th wedding anniversary  she canceled her plans to accompany Mr. Trump to the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland.

title: We Have Met the Enemy, and He Is Us
description: It is well documented that Americans are ever more divided: along party, ideological, socio-economic and cultural lines; by geographic, demographic, racial and religious differences. Our political polarization hampers our ability to tackle important national issues, whether immigration, infrastructure, timely budgeting or closing Guantnamo. The recent government shutdown and the looming threat of another underscore this problem.

title: A Science Denier at the Natural History Museum? Scientists Rebel
description: Rebekah Mercer, a supporter of President Trump and an influential donor to conservative causes  including groups that deny climate science  is under renewed pressure to step down from the board of New York Citys most prominent science museum, the American Museum of Natural History.

title: Trump Appointee Is Trying to Squelch Us, Labor Board Staff Says
description: The Trump administrations efforts to reverse the direction of federal labor policy appear to have accelerated with a proposal to demote the senior civil servants who resolve most labor cases.

title: In 5 Hours of Budget Hearing, Frustration With M.T.A.
description: ALBANY  From Hudson Valley trains to Nassau County bus shelters and Coney Island subways, Joseph J. Lhota, the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, seemed to have an answer Thursday for every question at a hearing over the authoritys part of the proposed state budget.

title: Allies or Terrorists: Who Are the Kurdish Fighters in Syria?
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  They seek to sweep away borders and establish a stateless society. Their female fighters struggle and die beside male comrades. Their leftist, anti-Islamist image has attracted American and European volunteers.

title: Why Are There So Few Third Basemen in the Hall of Fame?
description: Say this for third base: It has the best nickname of any position in baseball. Truth is, though, the hot corner can be pretty cold.

title: The Economics of Dirty Old Men
description: As a candidate, Donald Trump talked incessantly about international trade and how he was going to make America great again by renegotiating trade agreements, forcing foreigners to stop taking away our jobs. But during his first year in office, he did almost nothing on that front  possibly because corporate America managed to inform him that it has invested a lot of money based on the assumption that we would continue to honor Nafta and other trade agreements, and would lose bigly if he broke them.

title: Stephen Curry and LeBron James Reveal All-Star Rosters
description: It did not come with the excitement  or awkwardness  of a full public audience, but team captains LeBron James of the Cleveland Cavaliers and Stephen Curry of the Golden State Warriors completed the N.B.A.s 2018 All-Star draft on Thursday.

title: Belatedly, The Indianapolis Star Gets Its Due for Gymnastics Investigation
description: In April 2016, a few instances of nearby schools failing to report child abuse caught the attention of the investigations team at The Indianapolis Star. The journalists wondered how often it happened, and why.

title: The Jordan Peterson Moment
description: My friend Tyler Cowen argues that Jordan Peterson is the most influential public intellectual in the Western world right now, and he has a point. Peterson, a University of Toronto psychologist, has found his real home on YouTube, where his videos have attracted something like 40 million views.

title: Quotation of the Day: Passionate Kissing Defense Clears Sprinter Accused of Doping
description: Im like, how can I be negligent for kissing my girl?

title: Politics Shouldnt Be Like Open Mic Night
description: The number of Democrats aiming to unseat Republican incumbents in the midterm elections in November is rewriting the record books. According to the Campaign Finance Institute, by last fall the Democrats were fielding about twice the number of challengers as Republicans managed in 2009, the height of the Tea Party insurgency. In Wisconsin, 17 Democrats have filed papers to challenge Gov. Scott Walker; eight are running in Iowas open governors race.

title: Britains Handsy Old Boys Club
description: LONDON  In the post-Harvey Weinstein era, every institution and public company in Britain has been piously claiming to be concerned with how women are viewed, heard, treated and paid. And yet last week, 360 rich and powerful men in Britain were happy to pay 2,000 a head (about $2,800) to attend an evening fund-raiser hosted by the Presidents Club Charitable Trust, during which their female peers and partners were excluded, and the only women in the room were there as miniskirted sex objects whose explicit duty was to serve  and stroke the egos of  the men.

title: Trump Ordered Mueller Fired, but Backed Off When White House Counsel Threatened to Quit
description: WASHINGTON  President Trump ordered the firing last June of Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel overseeing the Russia investigation, according to four people told of the matter, but ultimately backed down after the White House counsel threatened to resign rather than carry out the directive.

title: Walmart Makes a Late Entry Into the E-Book Market
description: Walmart is making a circuitous and belated push into the digital book market, teaming up with a Japanese company to sell e-books and audiobooks.

title: With Larry Nassar Sentenced, Focus Is on What Michigan State Knew
description: Michigan State University was propelled on Thursday to the center of the sexual abuse scandal involving Dr. Lawrence G. Nassar, as state and federal agencies mounted investigations demanding to know what the college knew of his behavior and when.

title: Trumps Impromptu News Conference: An Unplanned Drop-By or a Deliberate Dig?
description: WASHINGTON  After hearing last week that President Trump had erupted in anger watching news clips of his chief of staff, John F. Kelly, telling a Fox News interviewer that the presidents view of a border wall was not fully informed, people around the White House wondered whether it was a mere blip, or a turning point in their relationship.

title: Jose Reyes Is Said to Return to Mets on One-Year Deal
description: The Mets are bringing back yet another player from last years team.

title: Lawsuit on Trump Emoluments Violations Gains Traction in Court
description: GREENBELT, Md.  A closely watched lawsuit claiming that President Trump is violating the Constitution by failing to divorce himself from his businesses appeared to inch forward on Thursday during a lengthy hearing before a federal judge in Maryland.

title: South Korea Hospital Fire Kills at Least 37 People
description: SEOUL, South Korea  A fire at a hospital that doubled as a nursing home killed at least 37 people on Friday in the southern city of Miryang, the latest in a string of tragedies that have heightened public concern over the countrys safety standards.

title: Tiger Woods Returns to PGA Tour With Tempered Expectations
description: SAN DIEGO  A new, surgically modified version of Tiger Woods, armed with new equipment and downsized expectations, launched his latest comeback on the PGA Tour on Thursday by shooting an even-par 72 on the South Course at Torrey Pines during the opening round of the Farmers Insurance Open.

title: After 174 Years, Hasty Pudding Theatricals at Harvard Will Cast Women
description: BOSTON  The Hasty Pudding Theatricals, an irreverent Harvard theater troupe that has not cast women since it began staging productions in 1844, announced on Thursday that, for the very first time, it would encourage women to audition this year.

title: Patrick Meehan Wont Seek Re-election in Pennsylvania
description: WASHINGTON  Representative Patrick Meehan, Republican of Pennsylvania, facing backlash after revelations that he settled a sexual harassment complaint brought by a former aide, will not seek re-election this year.

title: Review: In Jericho, Another Spin of the Romantic Carousel
description: Carousel is a problematic musical. Not for its score, which is gorgeous, but because its a romance with bruises  a love story between a spirited young woman and the bullying, short-fuse thug she marries. He hits her. She stays. Not exactly a lighthearted evening.

title: Verbal Outpouring
description: FRIDAY PUZZLE  Far be it from me to harp on an entry that might or might not violate the so-called Breakfast Test  a subjective look at entries that might be considered highly unpleasant if encountered while solving a puzzle with your breakfast  but lets talk about WORD VOMIT, which makes its New York Times Crossword debut today.

title: Are You in South Korea? Talk to Us About the Olympics
description: Read in Korean |

title: Museum Told White House: No Van Gogh, but Heres a Gold Toilet
description: Officials at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum were tight-lipped on Thursday night about an unusual email exchange in which its chief curator is said to have rebuffed a White House request for a Vincent van Gogh painting and offered a gold toilet instead.

title: Corrections: January 26, 2018
description: INTERNATIONAL

title: Will You Fire Mueller? How Trump Has Responded
description: In June President Trump ordered the firing of Robert Mueller, who has been leading the Russia investigation. For months, however, Mr. Trump dismissed the idea in his public statements.

title: Are Bitcoins More Real Than Boyfriends?
description: Recently, my brother experienced a cryptocurrency windfall. Almost overnight, $300 ballooned into tens of thousands, and now he can remodel his basement. Maybe. I dont know. I suppose he can if he finds the money lurking behind the math.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

description: Watch a broadcast of the Met Operas production of Norma. And pick from among several train capers.

description: Note: Our Fifth Annual 15-Second Vocabulary Video Challenge is underway. Submit your entry by Feb. 23 at 7 a.m. Eastern time.

title: Simona Halep vs. Caroline Wozniacki: One Will Finally Win the Big One
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  It is a challenge to pick the sentimental favorite in the womens singles final at the Australian Open.

title: In a Comically Drawn Pennsylvania District, the Voters Are Not Amused
description: KING OF PRUSSIA, Pa.  It was supposed to be a political firewall. It has become a laughingstock.

title: Headphones
description: What do you think this image is saying? How does it relate to and comment on current events? Can you personally relate to the photo illustration in any way? What is your opinion of its message?

title: Teaching Activities for: Is There Something Wrong With Democracy?
description: Before reading the article:

title: A Listening Ear for Musicians in Need
description: CARDIFF, Wales  At 11 p.m. here one recent Monday, Rob Aston, a 23-year-old former drum-and-bass M.C., was four hours into a shift at one of the worlds first mental health help lines for musicians.

title: Seth Meyers Skewers Chuck Schumer Over Dreamers Negotiations
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. What do you think of it? What else are you interested in? Let us know: thearts@nytimes.com.

title: Trump, in Davos Speech, Sticks to Script as He Declares America Open for Business
description: President Trump broke with precedent by delivering a speech at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, on Friday, saying that America first is not America alone.

title: Proenza Schouler and Rodarte Bring Fall Styles to Paris
description: PARIS  It always feels like something of an unfortunate cosmic coincidence that the World Economic Forum meeting in Davos, Switzerland, coincides with the couture shows: Both feature billionaires in their audiences, though in one place they are supposedly grappling with major world issues and in the other, they are  shopping. It could give you a complex.

title: China Embraces a Game About a Traveling Frog
description: BEIJING  A few short weeks after its release, a Japanese mobile game featuring a traveling frog has become a hit in China.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Poem: And He Stays Dead
description: Selected by Terrance Hayes

title: Letter of Recommendation: Rodney Dangerfield
description: Imagine having no talent. Imagine being no good at all at something and doing it anyway. Then, after nine years, failing at it and giving it up in disgust and moving to Englewood, N.J., and selling aluminum siding. And then, years later, trying the thing again, though it wrecks your marriage, and failing again. And eventually making a meticulous study of the thing and figuring out that, by eliminating every extraneous element, you could isolate what makes it work and just do that. And then, after becoming better at it than anyone who had ever done it, realizing that maybe you didnt need the talent. That maybe its absence was a gift.

title: New Sentences: From Bone, by Yrsa Daley-Ward
description: From the poem kid, by Yrsa Daley-Ward, as it appears in the collection Bone (Penguin Books, 2017, Page 119). Daley-Ward, who is also an actor, was born in England to a Jamaican mother and Nigerian father.

title: Behind the Cover: 1.28.18
description: Jake Silverstein, editor in chief: The notion of reinvention is fundamental to the personal philosophy of RuPaul Charles, the most famous drag performer in the world and the host of the show Drag Race. He styled himself for this shoot and had very specific ideas about everything from wardrobe to lighting. He seemed to embody the phrase we chose as the main cover line.

title: The 1.14.18 Issue
description: RE: TEACHERS

title: Deadly Fire Undermines South Korean Leaders Vow to Make Country Safer
description: SEOUL, South Korea  When President Moon Jae-in took power in South Korea last May, he vowed to make his disaster-prone country a safer place to live. But public skepticism over his ability to deliver has deepened with a string of tragedies in recent weeks, including a hospital fire that killed dozens of people on Friday.

title: Paperback Row
description: Six new paperbacks to check out this week.

title: A Sci-fi Writer Inspired by the Plight of Irish Immigrants
description: SPACE CRAFT: Fans of Pierce Browns swashbuckling sci-fi adventure series wont be surprised to learn that he loved world-building from an early age. When I was a kid, we moved around, and I was forced to grow up in lots of places. I spent a lot of time alone. Id go into the woods and build forts and create these huge imaginary scenes. When he wrote the first volume in his best-selling Red Rising series, I started with the main character and shaped my world around him, he says. I was inspired by the plight of Irish immigrants in the 19th century and by the disenfranchisement of working classes. Hes still dissecting social hierarchies in the fourth book in the series, Iron Gold, which debuts on this weeks hardcover fiction list at No. 3: Im exploring the lives of people who become casualties despite the best intentions of the storys heroes.

title: Jeffersons Three Daughters  Two Free, One Enslaved
description: JEFFERSONS DAUGHTERS Three Sisters, White and Black, in a Young America By Catherine Kerrison Illustrated. 425 pp. Ballantine Books. $28.

title: What Rachel Bloom Cant Travel Without
A Doctor Argues That Her Profession Needs to Slow Down, Stat
description: SLOW MEDICINE The Way to Healing By Victoria Sweet 289 pp. Riverhead Books. $27.

title: Delving Into the Bipolar Mind
description: GORILLA AND THE BIRD A Memoir of Madness and a Mothers Love By Zack McDermott 278 pp. Little, Brown. $27.

title: Sailing Into Today on a Boat From Our Past
description: I stepped off the sailboat onto the dock in Gibsons, British Columbia, and although it was solid, a moment of reverse seasickness made me feel as if the ground was swaying. I silently wondered if this sensation was similar to what my mother felt when she complained that her Parkinsons made her feel unsteady.

title: Judge John Hodgman on a Vexing Glam-Metal Lyric
description: Chris writes: My wife and I disagree on whether the Def Leppard song title Armageddon It is a pun. I insist that it is, at best, a moronic misspelling. She says that it fits the definition of a pun whether or not I think its funny. Does it?

title: What Should We Call Your Generation?
description: Do you consider yourself a millennial, or are you part of some other generational group?

title: President Trump, Please Read Desert Solitaire
description: In a 1973 TV spot, the United States Forest Service sage Smokey Bear admonished that one careless second with a match and America the beautiful becomes America the ugly. So what would Smokey say now when a few careless seconds with a pen allowed President Trump and Interior Secretary Ryan Zinke to remove protections from two million acres of precious American wilderness? If courts uphold Trumps executive orders of last December, they would reduce southern Utahs Bears Ears and Grand Staircase-Escalante monuments by 85 and 46 percent, respectively, constituting the biggest rollback of federally protected land in American history.

title: How to Change Your Gait
description: Focus downward. We tend to live in our heads, says Jessica Rose, a professor of orthopedic surgery at Stanford University and director of the Motion & Gait Lab at Lucile Packard Childrens Hospital in Palo Alto, Calif. We should be directing more attention to our feet.

title: How Have You Responded to Harassment?
description: About half of women, and many men, say they have experienced harassment of some form at work. Ask experts for advice, or tell us about you handled a situation, and experts will weigh in.

title: Fantasies for Young Readers, With an Eye on Todays Fears and Divisions
description: THE LOST RAINFOREST: MEZS MAGIC By Eliot Schrefer 368 pp. Katherine Tegen. $17. (Middle grade; ages 8 to 12)

title: A Publishers Life and Library
description: Some were alphabetical: Four Laurie Colwin novels shared a shelf with Evan S. Connells Mr. Bridge and Michael Chabons The Amazing Adventures of Kavalier & Clay. Other sections must have had a private logic: The Furies, by Fernanda Eberstadt, flanked by Bob Woodwards State of Denial, and On Truth, by the philosopher Harry Frankfurt. The library of the legendary former Random House publisher Howard Kaminsky, who died last summer, contained books by friends and mysteries he wrote with his wife, Susan, under the pseudonym Brooks Stanwood. In a high, far corner: The Art of the Deal, by Donald Trump, which he came to regret publishing. We asked some of Kaminskys friends and colleagues to share their thoughts on his collection.

title: What Is Chain Migration? Heres the Controversy Behind It
description: As Congress considers a deal to provide relief for young immigrants brought to the United States illegally as children, President Trump and his Republican allies are demanding an end to what they call chain migration, or family-based immigration.

title: When a Co-op Board Misbehaves
description: Ever since Liang Liang, who goes by Lily, and her husband moved into their two-bedroom apartment at the Gardens at Forest Hills, a 368-unit cooperative, in 2014, they have had problems with the co-ops board of directors.

title: With or Without U.S. Funding, Unesco Celebrates American Cities
description: In October, the Trump administration announced that the United States would withdraw from Unesco, the United Nations cultural organization known for its World Heritage sites program, by the end of 2018. But that rejection, tied to perceptions of anti-Israel bias, has not stopped Unesco from naming a number of American cities to its Creative Cities Network.

title: U.S. Economy Grew at 2.6% Rate in Fourth Quarter
description: The American economy finished off last year on a firm footing, and is poised for more vigorous growth in the months to come.

title: The Remote Control, Out of Control: Why  la Carte TV Is Too Much for a Trekkie
description: No, I have not watched the new Star Trek series. Sore subject. CBS is airing the latest spinoff, Star Trek: Discovery, only on CBS All Access, yet another paid video streaming service, in this case for $5.99 a month, or $9.99 without commercials. And Im not doing that.

title: The Nations Governors Spoke, and We Found a Few Surprises. (Yes, Really.)
description: There has been plenty of pomp and circumstance, and even more long-windedness, as governors from coast to coast stepped to rostrums this month to deliver their annual State of the State addresses.

title: Postcard People
description: Marilyn Stern held out a black-and-white postcard of a baby panda from 1948.

title: Notes From the Book Review Archives
description: This weeks cover reviews reflect on the state of the American Republic. In 1942, following a period of intense change and turmoil, Allan Nevins reviewed Henry Hazlitts A New Constitution Now, which argued for a radical reconstruction of the nation. Read an excerpt below.

title: News Quiz: Test Your Knowledge of the Weeks Headlines
description: Did you stay up to date this week?

title: Trump, Live From Davos
description: President Trump will address the World Economic Forum on Friday.

title: Teaching With: Taking a Knee and Taking Down A Monument
description: In this short documentary, Taking a Knee and Taking Down a Monument, a mother in Louisiana navigates racial tensions that flare up around her sons wish to kneel during the national anthem, and her own wish to have a local Confederate monument removed.

title: David Schwimmer Made Six Short Films About Sexual Harassment. We Annotate One of Them.
description: The actor worked with the director Sigal Avin to show what sexual harassment looks like. We asked experts to annotate one of the scripts, with ideas on how to prevent it.

description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Of Course the Christian Right Supports Trump
description: In 1958, the Baptist preacher Jerry Falwell, who would go on to found the Moral Majority, gave a sermon titled Segregation or Integration: Which? He inveighed against the Supreme Courts anti-segregation decision in Brown v. Board of Education, arguing that facilities for blacks and whites should remain separate.

title: We Cant Win in Afghanistan Because We Dont Know Why Were There
description: The United States is not losing in Afghanistan, but it is not winning either, and that is not good enough, reads the opening sentence of a top-secret review of the war in Afghanistan commissioned by President George W. Bush in 2008, according to multiple participants in that review. Subsequent classified reviews of the American strategy in the war have repeated that conclusion.

title: Falling Short on Science
description: Cambridge, Mass.  Amid the budget turbulence in Washington, its easy to miss the fact that part of whats at stake is Americas dominance in science, engineering and innovation. The United States has been the world leader in these categories for so long that we have stopped believing it could be any other way. But other nations, seeing us lose focus, are seizing the chance to rise.

title: Australian Open: Roger Federer Eases Into Final as Chung Retires
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  There have certainly been better Australia Day tennis celebrations at Melbourne Park. There have undoubtedly been much longer Australia Day tennis celebrations at Melbourne Park.

title: Time Travel for Photographers
description: AMSTERDAM  At first glance, the pictures look like something recovered from the bottom of a Dumpster. They are pitted and scuffed, covered with rust spots that resemble blooms of algae or craters on the surface of the moon. Only close up can you glimpse an image of a city, almost too murky to see: the outlines of an apartment building, a scattering of roofs and chimneys. Whatever was originally depicted has left only the ghostliest of imprints.

title: Building a Baby Sleep Machine in India
description: You might ask how two greasy, 15-pound iron pulleys could possibly be useful to a 5-month-old baby. The owner of the hole-in-the-wall hardware shop in India where we bought them wondered, too.

title: The Weekly Health Quiz: Infidelity, Weight Loss and Mushrooms
description: Test your knowledge of this weeks health news.

title: How Do I Avoid Catching Cold or Flu From My Sick Partner?
description: Q. When my spouse gets a bad cold or the flu, is there anything I can do to reduce the likelihood that I will get it? Would it make a difference if I avoid sleeping in the same bed or avoid handling the same objects (nearly impossible)? Assuming I am not going to move out of the house, are there any smaller steps that could help? Once symptoms are evident, is it already too late?

title: She Tackled Aristotle in an Opera. Next Up: Medieval French Couplets.
description: Steve Smith, writing in The New York Times a few years ago, called Here Be Sirens, an opera by Kate Soper, brainy, baffling, consistently astounding.

title: What the Sharing Economy Really Delivers: Entitlement
description: Not long ago a friend told me how she had come to end her relationship with WeWork, the entrepreneurial-class fun house that at recent count had been rolled out in 59 cities around the world. A playwright and producer, she had been renting office space at a WeWork location in Brooklyn when one night a little over a year ago, she showed up after a rehearsal to get some rewriting done and found a party in progress.

title: New York Today: Broadway Mania
description: Good morning on this crisp and sunny Friday.

title: Why Wait? When You Know, You Know
description: Melissa Gutierrez and Trevor Hinshaw were both raised in Christian homes, and when they met she literally gave him the shirt off her back.

title: Listen to The Daily: A Plan to Fire Mueller
description: President Trump tried to order the firing of Robert S. Mueller III, and Senator Chuck Schumer talks to us about seeking an immigration policy compromise.

description: Listen and subscribe to our podcast from your mobile device: Via Apple Podcasts | Via RadioPublic | Via Stitcher

title: She Boarded a Plane to See Her Dying Mother. Then Her Ticket Was Canceled.
description: In a hospital in Minnesota, Carrol Amrichs mother was dying.

title: How Roy Wood Jr., Comedian, Spends His Sundays
description: The comedian and actor Roy Wood Jr. still likes to drive; it gives him time to think, and it reminds him of his days honing his craft as a road comic. These days, Mr. Wood, 39, is a correspondent on The Daily Show With Trevor Noah, and starting Feb. 2, he will be the host of the new season of This Is Not Happening on Comedy Central. So while his weekends are for unwinding  spending quality time in Hells Kitchen, where Mr. Wood lives with Salone Monet, his girlfriend, and their toddler son  early Sunday mornings often begin in a rental car, with him racing home from another state after a night of telling jokes to a room full of strangers.

title: Wynn Resorts Slides on Report of Sexual Misconduct by C.E.O: DealBook Briefing
description: Good Friday. Heres what were watching:

title: On the Whole30 Diet, Vowing to Eat Smarter Carbs for More Than 30 Days
description: Last January, as one does, I pledged to eat better. Not one to phone it in, I adopted a meal plan with almost every vice crossed off the list. I blame Instagram, which was where I first spied the hashtag #Whole30, along with hundreds of iPhone-perfect images of delicious-looking food. If I ate nothing but whole, unprocessed foods for 30 days, the Whole30 program promised, I would have less bloating, fewer cravings, better sleep and more energy.

title: Your Week in Culture: Outsider Art, Claude Debussy, the Godfathers of Black Panther
description: New TV shows, museum openings, film releases and concerts  its a lot to keep track of. Let us help. For the week of Jan. 28, seven events in New York and elsewhere not to be missed:

title: A Storytelling Choreographer Who Listens to Her Audience
description: For an in-demand choreographer, Camille A. Brown spends an unusual amount of her time listening and responding to what audiences have to say. Often, what she hears is upsetting. Sometimes the most disturbing comments prove the most useful.

title: The Bachelor Goes International. Will Bachelor Nation Follow?
description: WILMINGTON, Vt.  Just after sundown on a Thursday in early December, Chris Harrison  host of The Bachelor and its spinoffs  stood in a mountaintop lodge in this Vermont ski town. The cavernous room had been draped in the fashion typical to Bachelor cocktail parties; candles burned, sequined pillows beckoned, and a stocked bar stood at the ready. Mr. Harrisons eyes scanned a cluster of sofas, all of them at that moment, empty.

title: McGahn in June, Other Republicans Soon
description: This article is part of the Opinion Today newsletter. You can sign up here to receive the newsletter each weekday.

title: California Today: In Final State of the State, Brown Touts Fast Train
description: Good morning.

title: Farhads Week in Tech: Netflix Is a Monster, and Apples HomePod Arrives Soon
description: Each Friday, Farhad Manjoo, technology columnist at The New York Times, reviews the weeks news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

title: The Western Edge of Hells Kitchen Goes Residential
description: It is still a good place to service cars and ship packages. But with gathering speed, the western edge of Hells Kitchen is going residential, and in the process, it is becoming New Yorks latest industrial district to reinvent itself.

title: Sharing Events From Other Google Calendars
description: Q. I work for a school that uses Google apps, including Gmail. Although the mail address is @myschool.com, it is a Google account, and I use the Google Calendar almost exclusively. I also have a personal Gmail account, but I almost never use the calendar. Im retiring in June, and Id like to get all the old and upcoming appointments, events, birthdays  everything  moved to my personal Google calendar before my school access ends. Is this possible?

title: On Journalistic Curiosity: Down the Rabbit Hole With Dan Barry
description: The actual, not virtual, library of The New York Times is in the basement catacombs of the building, located at the end of a lab-white labyrinthine hall. Its venerable collection is rarely visited these days, since a few keystrokes deliver the world.

title: Its Tax Time: What to Remember
description: Tax season officially opens next week, so its time to get your documents organized if you havent already.

title: Senate Democrats Seek to Protect Mueller From Being Fired
description: WASHINGTON  Senate Democrats said on Friday that they would seek to ensure that continuing budget negotiations included legislation to protect Robert S. Mueller III, the special counsel in the Russia investigation, from being fired by President Trump.

title: Cecile Richards on Her Life After Planned Parenthood
description: According to Cecile Richards, the president of Planned Parenthood for over a decade, protesters who wave anti-abortion signs outside one of the organizations clinics will sometimes return  a week, a month or a year later  for an annual medical exam.

title: Mr. Lincoln Goes to Hollywood (and Looks Like Henry Fonda)
description: John Fords Young Mr. Lincoln, released in 1939 and now on Blu-ray in a new 4K digital restoration from Criterion, is a prime example of American mythmaking. It can hardly be coincidental that  wearing his trademark stovepipe hat  the nations destined savior, Abraham Lincoln (Henry Fonda, given a prosthetic nose), arrives in the rowdy western town of Springfield, Ill., like Jesus, riding on a mule.

title: Adam Pally Is Very, Very Nervous
description: Adam Pallys career may be in jeopardy. At least he thinks so. Best known to audiences for his television roles on Happy Endings and The Mindy Project, Mr. Pally is jumping into theater, starring in a new play Off Broadway  Cardinal by Greg Pierce  at the Second Stage Theater.

title: This Horror Movie Is Based on a True Story. Sort Of.
description: The Winchester Mystery House in San Jose, Calif., is incredibly whimsical or intensely eerie, depending on how you view such things, with stairs leading to the ceiling and doors that open to nowhere. The grand estate was the home of Sarah Winchester, heiress to the Winchester Repeating Arms fortune, who, according to legend, had workers ceaselessly laboring on the house for decades, from 1884 until her death in 1922. She undertook the project at the behest of a New England seer to delay her own demise, one version of the story goes, or to calm the spirits of the thousands of souls killed throughout the ages by Winchester rifles, as another version has it.

title: In the Studio With an Actress-Turned-Painter
description: I love crosshatching, said the painter Leelee Kimmel, walking around her Upper East Side studio on a recent morning. The space is a converted prewar apartment, and her large, spattery abstract paintings provide a sharp contrast to the clean moldings. Were the generation of crosshatching, when you think about it, she added. Because were always hashtagging everything.

title: Floods Leave Paris Contemplating a Wetter Future
description: PARIS  Must France simply get used to flooding?

title: Beef and Onions, Made Better With Beer
description: Gently cooked onions, simmered in butter or oil until they collapse in a golden-brown heap, need very little help to become a meal.

title: Sam at the Games
description: View the latest messages from Sam Manchester, a New York Times journalist, who is on the ground at the Winter Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea.

description: Sam Manchester, a New York Times journalist, is on the ground in Pyeongchang, South Korea, sending you messages from the Winter Games.

title: What to Cook This Weekend
description: Good morning. We are just a little more than a week from Super Bowl LII, the Eagles playing the Patriots, and I suppose we are just about due for the annual run of stories on increased sales of avocados and chicken wings. If you happen to be the sort of person to plan out your secular feasting, this weekend would be a good one to spreadsheet our ace collection of football-friendly recipes.

title: A Sober Trump Reassures the Davos Elite
description: DAVOS, Switzerland  On the campaign trail, Donald J. Trump the candidate denounced what he called the false song of globalism. A year after taking office, President Trump came on Friday to tell the elites at Davos, who composed the song, that maybe they could still perform in harmony.

title: RuPauls Drag Race All Stars: You Can Kill Evil
description: Hello, hello, hello! RuPauls Drag Race All Stars returned for its third season last night  thank God, or thank RuPaul, however you worship. The show, a spinoff of RuPauls Drag Race, pits runners-up and fan favorites from past seasons against each other for a second chance at glory  glory being $100,000 and a spot in the Drag Race Hall of Fame, parodied in a clever cold open with the two previous winners Chad Michaels and Alaska (renamed Ofrupaul) strolling in Handmaids Tale garb. The Drag Race Hall of Fame really isnt what I thought it was going to be, Alaska said. You look really nice in red, though.

title: Classical Music in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to the citys best classical music and opera.

title: How a Church Deacon Found the Biggest Prime Number Yet (It Wasnt as Hard as You Think)

description: THE YEARS, MONTHS, DAYS Two Novellas By Yan Lianke Translated by Carlos Rojas. 192 pp. Black Cat. Paper, $16.

title: A Satisfying Soup From the Italian Pantry
description: Some soups are delicate, light and refreshing, served as the prelude to a meal. Others, like this one, are hearty and nourishing meals in themselves. It is not precisely a soup, but a soupy concoction of potatoes and pasta, known throughout Italy as pasta e patate.

description: Name Jaimie Wilson

description: There was more reckoning on Friday from the failure to stop Lawrence G. Nassar, who is accused of serially abusing more than 150 young women while he was a doctor at Michigan State University and for the national womens gymnastics team. The fallout stretched from the university to U.S.A. Gymnastics to Capitol Hill.

title: Hillary Clinton Chose to Shield a Top Adviser Accused of Harassment in 2008
description: WASHINGTON  A senior adviser to Hillary Clintons 2008 presidential campaign who was accused of repeatedly sexually harassing a young subordinate was kept on the campaign at Mrs. Clintons request, according to four people familiar with what took place.

description: HERE IN BERLIN By Cristina Garca Illustrated. 208 pp. Counterpoint. $26.

title: Trumps Efforts to Oust Mueller Show the Cancer on This Presidency
description: Thursdays report in The Times that President Trump ordered the firing of the special counsel Robert Mueller last June, only to back off after the White House counsel, Donald McGahn, threatened to resign, is explosive on many levels.

title: BBC, Criticized Over Pay Gap, Cuts Salaries of Some Male Journalists
description: LONDON  The BBC said on Friday that it was reducing the salaries of several of its most prominent male journalists following Carrie Gracies decision this month to leave her position as the British broadcasters China editor to protest unequal pay between men and women at the organization.

title: Can Digital Technology Open Up the Art World?
description: LONDON  Regardless of whether youre a multibillion-dollar investment banker, or someone who wants to spend just a few hundred on something nice to hang on the wall, its difficult not to be intimidated by the art market.

description: Our guide to cultural events in New York City for families with children and teenagers.

description: While a cesarean delivery is sometimes necessary and can be lifesaving, it may have serious long-term disadvantages for both mother and child, researchers report.

title: A Tennis Coach Is a Reluctant Passenger on the Road
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  Elise Tamaela did not expect to be back in tennis. And whenever her current job coaching the Serbian player Aleksandra Krunic ends, she does not plan to pursue another one.

description: Our guide to film series and special screenings. All our movie reviews are at nytimes.com/reviews/movies.

description: Our guide to stand-up, improv and variety shows.

description: Lisa Vanderpump doesnt merely walk. She strides, almost gallops.

title: Snapshots From a Land of Endless Night
description: For those who live just above the Arctic Circle, there is at least one day a year when the sun never pushes above the horizon. But there are many people who live even farther north who, after the winter solstice, dont see the sun for weeks.

title: Dance in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to dance performances.

title: Art and Museums in NYC This Week
description: Our guide to new art shows  and some that will be closing soon.

title: As States Legalize Marijuana, Investors See an Opportunity
description: New Jerseys new governor, Phil Murphy, made access to medical marijuana easier in the Garden State this week. A few weeks earlier, California, with its nearly 40 million people, legalized recreational marijuana use, having cleared the way for medical marijuana in 1996.

title: Consumer Confidence Is Lifting the Economy. But for How Much Longer?
description: Amid the constant turmoil in domestic and global politics these days, the economys steady expansion has been a source of comfort. But look more closely and you will find that economic growth rests on a surprisingly amorphous base: consumer confidence.

title: In Davos Speech, Trump Mixes Facts With Fiction
description: WASHINGTON  In a speech on Friday to world and financial leaders at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, President Trump mixed facts, falsehoods and claims that could use context.

title: What to Say When You Meet the Angel of Death at a Party
description: DURHAM, N.C.  EVERY 90 days I lie in a whirling CT machine, dye coursing through my veins, and the doctors look to see whether the tumors in my liver are growing. If they are not, the doctors smile and schedule another scan. The rhythm has been the same since my doctors told me I had stage IV colon cancer two and a half years ago. I live for three months, take a deep breath and hope to start over again. I will probably do this for the rest of my life. Whatever that means.

title: You Cant Fire Equifax, but Your Employer Can. Mine Just Did.
description: After the Equifax data breach in early September, readers asked one question repeatedly that had no good answer: Was there any way to punish the company?

title: That Time Murphy Brown and Dan Quayle Topped the Front Page
description: Is Murphy Brown really a tramp?

title: Jane Birkin on Love, Life and Serge Gainsbourgs Classical Roots
description: Jane Birkin was the longtime muse and partner of the classic French songwriter Serge Gainsbourg. And from the moment they recorded Je TAime  Moi Non Plus, a cheerfully (and explicitly) erotic duet that became a major succs de scandale, she became one of his greatest interpreters. Even after their breakup, she continued to sing the songs he wrote for her in her delicate, vulnerable voice.

title: Politically Outspoken Director of Queens Museum Steps Down
description: In the end, the very political activism that defined Laura Raicovichs tenure as the president and executive director of the Queens Museum drove her out the door. On Friday, after just three years at the helm, Ms. Raicovich announced that she was stepping down.

title: Twilights Last Gleaming?
description: Subscribe: iTunes | Google Play Music
